message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DS, cs.MA, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of maximizing the size of a target audience covered by a marketing or awareness-raising campaign through recruiting influential individuals in a social network. This problem is related to social influence maximization, which falls under the category of social network analysis. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses network sampling algorithms and their performance in terms of cover size, which falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The proposed algorithm is a greedy online algorithm that maximizes the expected size of the cover, which involves making decisions based on incomplete information, and therefore falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the topology of the social network and its impact on the performance of the algorithm, which falls under the category of computational mathematics (cs.MA). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of discovering the network topology on-the-fly, which is related to the field of computational social science (cs.SOC).
